snippet: Two artists belatedly learned that they play integral roles on “Harlem Shake,” a Web sensation that became a No. 1 hit on the pop chart, and both are seeking compensation.
abstract: Former reggaeton artist Hector Delgado and rapper Jayson Musson are seeking compensation from Mad Decent Records after learning that their sampled voices can be heard on song Harlem Shake by Harry Bauer Rodrigues, who performs under name Baauer; song has gone from Web sensation to No 1 hit on pop chart.
lead_paragraph: Two artists belatedly learned that they play integral roles on “Harlem Shake,” a Web sensation that became a No. 1 hit on the pop chart, and both are seeking compensation.

headline.seo: Baauer’s ‘Harlem Shake’ Hits No. 1 With Unlicensed Samples
headline.main: Surprise Hit Was a Shock for Artists Heard on It
headline.print_headline: Surprise Hit Was a Shock For Artists Heard on It
